meanings.definition: To withdraw into one's shell or retreat from a situation.
meanings.sent1: After the argument, he felt overwhelmed and started turtling in his room.
meanings.sent2: The shy turtle was turtling away from the noisy crowd.
meanings.sent3: When the teacher asked a difficult question, the student tried turtling under the desk, pretending to be a turtle.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were turtling inside her like a turtle hiding in its shell.
meanings.sent5: The idea of public speaking made him feel like turtling into his own world.

meanings.definition: The act of playing defensively in a video game.
meanings.sent1: His turtling in the game annoyed his friends who preferred aggressive play.
meanings.sent2: Turtling can be a successful strategy in certain video game scenarios.
meanings.sent3: The player's turtling style made the game last longer than usual.
meanings.sent4: Her brother's turtling reminded her of a turtle hiding in its shell.
meanings.sent5: The turtling approach helped him survive longer in the game.

meanings.definition: A strategy in which a player focuses on building up defenses rather than attacking.
meanings.sent1: The team's turtling surprised their opponents who expected an aggressive approach.
meanings.sent2: Turtling can be an effective way to outlast opponents in a game.
meanings.sent3: His turtling in the match made his friends laugh as he built wall after wall.
meanings.sent4: The turtling tactic was like a fortress protecting the player from attacks.
meanings.sent5: The player's turtling paid off when the opponents couldn't break through the defenses.
